title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1.56 - Executive Order No. 56: [Placing requirement on Attorney General in relation to certain crimes committed by public servants in the County of Bronx.] [DAGGER]
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1.56 - Executive Order No. 56: [Placing requirement on Attorney General in relation to certain crimes committed by public servants in the County of Bronx.] [DAGGER]
State Regulations

Executive Order No. 56.01*
Executive Order No. 56.02*
Executive Order No. 56.03*
Executive Order No. 56.04*
Executive Order No. 56.05
TO: THE HONORABLE LOUIS J. LEFKOWITZ ATTORNEY GENERAL OF
THE STATE OF NEW YORK STATE CAPITOL ALBANY, NEW YORK......................................................................................................................... Article I of my order and requirement to you, embodied in

Executive Order Number fifty-six dated September nineteenth, nineteen hundred
seventy-two, is hereby amended by relettering subdivision (c) thereof to be
subdivision (d) and adding thereto one new subdivision, to be subdivision (c), to read as follows: "(c) without limiting the foregoing provisions, any and all
acts and omissions and alleged acts and omissions by any person occurring
heretofore or hereafter in the County of Bronx in violation of any provision of

State of local law and arising out of, relating to or in any way connected with
the receipt, possession, or disposal of dangerous drugs by the Police

Department of the City of New York, its officers, employees, or agents;"
Signed: Nelson A. Rockefeller

Dated: December 28, 1972

Executive Order No. 56.06
TO: THE HONORABLE LOUIS J. LEFKOWITZ ATTORNEY GENERAL OF
THE STATE OF NEW YORK STATE CAPITOL ALBANY, NEW YORK......................................................................................................................... WHEREAS, on the nineteenth day of September, one thousand
nine hundred seventy-two, I made a requirement upon you, embodied in Executive

Order Number fifty-six, in relation to the County of the Bronx, New York; and
WHEREAS, on the thirty-first day of December, one thousand
nine hundred seventy-two, the term of the District Attorney of Bronx County
shall expire; and
WHEREAS, on the first day of January, one thousand nine
hundred seventy-three, the term of the newly elected District Attorney of Bronx

County shall commence: NOW, THEREFORE, I do hereby affirm and continue my order
and requirement upon you, embodied in Executive Order Number fifty-six and
dated the nineteenth day of September, one thousand nine hundred seventy-two; as amended by: Executive Order Number 56.01, dated the twelfth day of October, one thousand nine hundred seventy-two; Executive Order Number 56.02 dated the
sixteenth day of November, one thousand nine hundred seventy-two; Executive

Order Number 56.03, dated the twenty-ninth day of November, one thousand nine
hundred seventy-two; Executive Order Number 56.04, dated the twenty-sixth day
of December, one thousand nine hundred seventy-two; Executive Order Number
56.05, dated the twenty-eighth day of December, one thousand nine hundred
seventy-two; and as hereafter amended; effective the first day of January, one
thousand nine hundred seventy-three. Signed: Nelson A. Rockefeller

Dated: December 29, 1972

Executive Order No. 56.26
TO: THE HONORABLE LOUIS J. LEFKOWITZ ATTORNEY GENERAL OF
THE STATE OF NEW YORK STATE CAPITOL ALBANY, NEW YORK......................................................................................................................... In view of the request of Special Deputy Attorney General

John F. Keenan, and the request of District Attorney of Bronx County, Mario

Merola, Article I of the order and requirement to you, embodies in Executive

Order Number fifty-six dated September nineteenth, nineteen hundred
seventy-two, is hereby amended by relettering subdivision (e) thereof to be
subdivision (f) and adding thereto one new subdivision, to be subdivision (e)
to read as follows: (e) Any and all unlawful acts or omissions or alleged
unlawful acts or omissions by any person arising out of, relating to or in any
way connected with the subject matter of an investigation presently pending in
the Office of the Special Prosecutor, entitled: People
v. John Doe, Special Prosecutor Case Number 77-0435(a)-BX. Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: January 5, 1978

Executive Order No. 56.27*
Executive Order No. 56.28
TO: THE HONORABLE LOUIS J. LEFKOWITZ ATTORNEY GENERAL OF
THE STATE OF NEW YORK STATE CAPITOL ALBANY, NEW YORK......................................................................................................................... In view of the request of Special Deputy Attorney General

John F. Keenan, and the consent of District Attorney of Bronx County, Mario

Merola, Article I of the order and requirement to you, embodied in Executive

Order Number fifty-six dated September nineteenth, nineteen hundred
seventy-two, is hereby amended by relettering subdivision (f) thereof to be
subdivision (g) and adding thereto one new subdivision, to be subdivision (f), to read as follows: (f) Any and all unlawful acts or omissions or alleged
unlawful acts or omissions by any person arising out of, relating to or in any
way connected with the subject matter of an investigation presently pending in
the Office of the Special Prosecutor, entitled: People
v. John Doe, Special Prosecutor's Office Case Number 78-0257-Bronx. Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: May 23, 1978

Executive Order No. 56.29*
Executive Order No. 56.30
TO: THE HONORABLE ROBERT ABRAMS ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE
STATE OF NEW YORK STATE CAPITOL ALBANY, NEW YORK......................................................................................................................... In view of the request of Special Deputy Attorney General

John F. Keenan, and the request of the District Attorney of Bronx County, Mario

Merola, Article I of the order and requirement to you, embodied in Executive

Order Number fifty-six dated September nineteenth, nineteen hundred
seventy-two, is hereby amended by relettering subdivision (g) thereof to be
subdivision (h) and adding thereto one new subdivision, to be subdivision (g), to read as follows: (g) Any and all unlawful acts or omissions or alleged
unlawful acts or omissions by any person arising out of, relating to, or in any
way connected with the subject matter of an investigation or investigations
presently pending in the Office of the Special Prosecutor, entitled: People
v. John Doe, Special Prosecutor's Office Case Number 78-0529-Bronx. Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: January 4, 1979

Executive Order No. 56.31*
Executive Order No. 56.32*
Executive Order No. 56.33
TO: THE HONORABLE ROBERT ABRAMS ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE
STATE OF NEW YORK STATE CAPITOL ALBANY, NEW YORK......................................................................................................................... In view of the request of Special Deputy Attorney General

Roderick C. Lankler, and the request of the District Attorney of Bronx County, Mario Merola, Article I of the order and requirement to you, embodied in

Executive Order Number fifty-six dated September nineteenth, nineteen hundred
seventy-two, is hereby amended by relettering subdivision (h) thereof to be
subdivision (i) and adding thereto one new subdivision, to be subdivision (h), to read as follows: (h) Any and all unlawful acts or omissions or alleged
unlawful acts or omissions by any person arising out of, relating to or in any
way connected with a criminal proceeding presently pending in the Criminal

Court of the City of New York, Bronx County, entitled: People
v. Edward Nickens, Docket Number X-916759. Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: August 9, 1979

ยง
1.56

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
